Open-space.title: Social Games with Zero Knowledge Proofs
Open-space.abstract: Case studies of a few projects that use a zk formulation to create an interesting social experience. e.g. EthDOS, and a forward looking discussion of what games become possible given the current constraints on zk design space.

persons.biography: Daanish is a privacy researcher and a fiction writer. Previously he has been affiliated with Nvidia, where he was a Deep Learning researcher, and at Stanford, where he studied Electrical Engineering. For more: daanish.life

Open-space.title: #FreeAlex Web3 activism handbook
Open-space.abstract: The Tornado Cash case showed that open-source development is under attack. It's time for a Web3 activism movement to build & facilitate practical tools of direct action. Let's start with a handbook mapping down on-chain & off-chain tools for #FreeAlex campaign. Free for everyone to act now.

persons.biography: I accelerate companies, institutions & state actors to create fair digital societies empowered with the Web3. I helped ethical web3 startups fundraise $100 mln., deliver 200 GitHub repositories, grow communities above 100K members. Anti-surveillance tech advocate.

Open-space.title: The blind signing of contracts interaction
Open-space.abstract:
Users' interaction with smart contracts requires trust in several technologies: FrontEnd app, Wallet app, HW wallet, smart contract or protocol, and blockchain.

Blind signing deteriorates this trust.
Open-space.description:
By signing the transaction user expressly acknowledges and agrees that she understands what she is signing. Is this still valid?

The blind signing issue resonated heavily on the OG Council discussion during ETH Amsterdam 2022. Almost half of the attendees
relied on a Trezor T device, a similar amount on a Ledger device. All these attendees claimed to suffer from the blind-signing issue.
Several examples of stolen assets are already due to the planted function parameters and hacked Metamask when interacting with contracts. Millions of USD.

Yet, these HW wallets do not show the contract's call with parameters and values. Instead, they show some data gibberish.

Can we improve that? And bring the signing confidence back to users?

Open-space.title: Opening ceremony & Kickoff
Open-space.abstract: Opening ceremony - Introduction to the ETHBrno hackathon, basics, schedule and important dates and times, voting mechanism explanation and other practical information.

Conference room.title: Free the Web
Conference room.abstract: Why and how to build decentralized web sites.
Conference room.description: In this workshop I'll introduce the main technological options we have today for building on the web, mainly from a privacy perspective. After that we will build a site that can be hosted on a decentralized system with a zero need for expensive rebuilds (data are loaded on the client side using a very simple version of stale-while-revalidate pattern).

persons.biography: Adam is a seasoned software engineering veteran with years of experience in senior management positions. He left to follow his passion for web3 technologies and decentralized organizations.

Conference room.title: Armada: decentralised frontends
Conference room.abstract: Technical workshop how to build a decentralised frontend using the armada project. Basic coding skills and having a laptop required.

persons.biography:
CEO of Wido (joinwido.com)
Ex PM @ Argent

Conference room.title: dm3 - Decentralized, end-2-end encrypted web3 Messaging
Conference room.abstract: The aim of the talk is to introduce the dm3 protocol and show how secure communication can be integrated into a DApp with only a few lines of code.
Conference room.description:
Email, SMS, and messengers such as WhatsApp, Signal, Telegram, and others are known and used by almost everyone today. The lack of comprehensive end-to-end encryption (e.g., for e-mail) and closed silos for central messenger services are currently common. Cross-application communication is not possible. User profiles are under the control of large corporations.
With the web3, we have new possibilities like key-based identities, decentralized register on the blockchain, and end-to-end encryption, ...
With dm3, there exists a lean protocol for peer-2-peer messaging, which makes it possible to easily integrate secure communication into DApps. The user always has full control over his contacts and information. Intermediaries controlling the communication are not needed.

persons.biography:
Co-founder, researcher, and developer at corpus.ventures, Steffen is primarily involved in the technical development of our products. Mathematical optimization, numerics, artificial intelligence, and web3 technologies are part of Steffenâ€™s toolkit.
His career goes back to 2000 in the automotive industry developing mathematical methods and simulation software. Since 2017 he has been working in web3 and brought to life proof-of-concept prototypes and real-life products utilizing blockchain technologies.

Conference room.title: Getting into EVM and understanding modular blockchain infrastructure
Conference room.abstract: The talk will delve into some ingrained details and a high-level understanding of EVM, especially from Solidity language interaction perspectives, we will also talk a bit about Circom and how we can enable modular blockchain infrastructure in the current state of blockchain development.

persons.biography: Engineering @ Polygon, EthIndia alum, ex-Moonshot Collective

Sky room.title: Cicada 3301: An Internet Mystery (2018)
Sky room.abstract: "In this video I explore an elaborate cryptographic internet puzzle orchestrated by a mysterious individual or group known as Cicada 3301." - LEMMiNO

Sky room.title: Hopium Diaries - Dystopian Dreams (2021)
Sky room.abstract: The fire is growing, and a new financial world is emerging. Follow our anonymous author into a future of finance. Not one that will be but one that might be.

Sky room.title: Lunarpunk and the Dark Side of the Cycle (2022)
Sky room.abstract: The conflict between old and new power structures is preprogrammed.  While solarpunks join DAOs, lunarpunks prepare for war. By favouring transparency in its systems, solarpunk is tragically engineering its fate. The only hope for solarpunk is to go dark.

Conference room.title: Constant Function Market Making, Social Welfare & MEV
Conference room.abstract:
We consider the social welfare that can be facilitated by a constant function market maker (CFMM).
When there is sufficient liquidity available to the CFMM, it can approximate the optimal social welfare
when all users transactions are executed. When one of the agent has the role of proposing the block, and
blockspace is scarce, they can obtain higher expected utility than otherwise identical agents. This gives
a lower bound on the maximal extractable value exposed when blockspace is scarce.

persons.biography:
Broadly, I am motivated to work towards the improvement of the understanding. Designing, building and understanding the computational engines that mediate collective cognition. Methodologically my tools come mostly from economics and machine learning. I enjoy theory-driven work and opportunistic experimentation. In a broad sense, I care about: How can we design better ways of evaluating proposed policies given the existing observational data? Beyond the ICU, I have also studied various markets (betting, cryptocurrencies, Internet advertising) and related institutions.

http://www.nikete.com/about/

Conference room.title: Do not sign gibberish
Conference room.abstract:
Signing DApp transactions for EVM chains is a security nightmare, as it's very common for users to blindly approve a signature request while being completely oblivious to what the transaction does. This remains a very popular attack vector, taking advantage of the lack of information available to users while signing transactions.

In this talk, we'll develop an understanding of Ethereum calldata, and learn how you can decode it reveal insights about seemingly opaque transactions. I'll also present some of our recent efforts at Brave to bring more safety and transparency to the transaction approval process in Brave Wallet.

persons.biography: Anirudha is a Wallet Engineer at Brave, where he works on a multi-chain native crypto wallet. He previously worked at Ledger on custody infrastructure for financial institutions. In his spare time, he can be found managing geth nodes on his RaspberryPi.

Conference room.title: Gateway to the Lens Protocol
Conference room.abstract: Join the discussion about the Lens Protocol and become eligible to claim your Lens handle.
Conference room.description: Lens Protocol is a composable and decentralized social graph, ready for you to build on so you can focus on creating a great experience, not scaling your users. Our campfire is the first step for both developers and users to join the ecosystem. Having an official support from the Lens Builder Garden, during the campfire, attendees will be able to claim their Lens handle.

Conference room.title: LochDex - IDO privacy with trustless dark pools
Conference room.abstract: We propose a federated and untrusted way to construct a dark pool with the utilization of various zero-knowledge protocols in order to protect private investor privacy in IDO fundraising models.
Conference room.description: Private investors are subjected to the censorship (liquidity manipulation, personal coercion) of their token movements if they plan to exit with a significant volume, or operate on a low-volume LP pool. Large movements of team members or investors also create hysterical speculation on markets which also makes larger movements unfillable, especially with MEV attackers in mind. We propose a federated trustless alternative to dark pools, which contrary to tornado-cash style privacy solutions, is a recognized and allowed activity by the SEC.

persons.biography: Silur started his career as a pentester and hacker at a really young age, with a great affinity to cryptography and higher mathematics. Having a good prior understanding in cryptocurrencies when the industry boomed in 2016, he gained an advantage as an early industry specialist, doing work for the Ethereum foundation until 2018. In 2019 he designed a cipher that entered the NIST Lightweight Encryption Standard competition. Consequently, he proved himself in designing and implementing blockchains from scratch as the co-founder of QANPlatform and as an early partner of CasperLabs. Having built dozens of dApps, protocols and full chains from both mass-market and government clients, Silur is also a co-organizer of the largest Capture the flag event on the planet, in which he challenges the best hackers in the world to break blockchain systems and reproduce historical cryptocurrency hacks. Silur is also a member of the Wigner's research centre of physics where he specializes on quantum computation and post-quantum cryptography.

Conference room.title: Why We Should Care About Privacy
Conference room.abstract: Privacy is a fundamental right, and a right that enables other human rights. In this presentation, Kurt Opsahl will explain what privacy means, why itâ€™s important, and how we can protect privacy by building and supporting privacy enhancing technologies.

persons.biography: Kurt Opsahl is the Deputy Executive Director and General Counsel of the Electronic Frontier Foundation. In addition to representing clients on civil liberties, free speech and privacy law, Opsahl counsels on EFF projects and initiatives.  Opsahl is the lead attorney on the Coders' Rights Project, and is representing several companies who are challenging National Security Letters.  Before joining EFF, Opsahl worked at Perkins Coie, where he represented technology clients with respect to intellectual property, privacy, defamation, and other online liability matters, including working on Kelly v. Arribasoft, MGM v. Grokster and CoStar v. LoopNet. For his work responding to government subpoenas, Opsahl is proud to have been called a "rabid dog" by the Department of Justice. Prior to Perkins, Opsahl was a research fellow to Professor Pamela Samuelson at the U.C. Berkeley School of Information Management & Systems. Opsahl received his law degree from Boalt Hall, and undergraduate degree from U.C. Santa Cruz. Opsahl co-authored "Electronic Media and Privacy Law Handbook." In 2007, Opsahl was named as one of the "Attorneys of the Year" by California Lawyer magazine for his work on the O'Grady v. Superior Court appeal. From 2014 to 2022, Opsahl served on the USENIX Board of Directors. Opsahl is a member of the Filecoin Foundation Advisory Board and the CISA Cybersecurity Advisory Committeeâ€™s Technical Advisory Council.

Conference room.title: Understanding MEV and its importance for Ethereum or Whatâ€™s going on with Ethereumâ€™s MEV-Boost?
Conference room.abstract:
Suggested topic: 
How MEV-boost works from a purely technical perspective (we will not discuss the benefits of running MEV-boost as it already has been done by Hasu and Stephane Gosselin in [*why run mev-boost*](https://writings.flashbots.net/writings/why-run-mevboost)).

Instead, we will focus on the current state of the implementation of MEV-boost, and open a discussion on the near future and the ideas for the improvement of the solution.
Conference room.description:
Suggested topic: 
How MEV-boost works from a purely technical perspective (we will not discuss the benefits of running MEV-boost as it already has been done by Hasu and Stephane Gosselin in [*why run mev-boost*](https://writings.flashbots.net/writings/why-run-mevboost)).

Instead, we will focus on the current state of the implementation of MEV-boost, and open a discussion on the near future and the ideas for the improvement of the solution.

persons.biography:

https://www.kiln.fi/post/kiln-is-the-first-node-operator-to-ever-deploy-flashbots-solution-on-pos-ethereum

Conference room.title: Create a ZK Badge for your users or community in 15 minutes
Conference room.abstract: ZK Badges is a new web3 primitive for users to import their reputation or history to their wallets in a privacy preserving way.
Conference room.description:
How to prove that you donated to Gitcoin grants or that you voted for a specific DAO proposal without giving out your Ethereum address?
How to aggregate your reputation from multiple wallets?
Built as a new primitive, ZK Badges enable you to: - Import reputation from an account to another - Selectively reveal personal data - Aggregate your personal data from multiple accounts

Conference room.title: Otterscan, an open source, local block explorer for EVM chains
Conference room.abstract: The Ethereum community still relies on very centralized infra, the most important one being block explorers. I'll show a very lightweight alternative anyone can run at home, a perfect companion to your Erigon node.

Open-space.title: Twelve thoughts on the future of Web3
Open-space.abstract: Thoughts and predictions from a full-stack developer with over seven years of working in this industry and helping teams
Open-space.description:
Highlights include:

* Why most L2s will die and that's ok
* Why we need to think mobile first from now on
* Why good companies will have to embrace part-time work
* Why the world needs more open protocols
* What will eventually replace Solidity
